name: Parmalet (Crisp Parmesan Omelet)
author: Chef John
summary: I was attempting to achieve a crispy, inside-out Parmesan omelet--and it worked! The caramelized cheese formed a thin but protective layer and, since the eggs had never directly touched the pan, they were moist and tender. This will also work whether you use one or three eggs, depending on the texture you're going for. Using a single egg is kind of a cool trick, since the cheese layer is almost as thick, and you can really appreciate the crispness even more.
ingredients: 1 ounce freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, or a little less
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Crack eggs into a mixing bowl
Whisk together until just beaten (do not overmix)
Drizzle olive oil into 8-inch nonstick skillet
Brush evenly over the bottom of the pan
Evenly grate cheese into the skillet approximately 1/2-inch deep (or just shy of 1 ounce)
Cheese will slowly start to melt
When cheese starts to bubble and turn golden brown, about 4 minutes, pour eggs evenly over cheese
Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and cayenne
Cover and let eggs cook on low until they are set, checking after the first 30 seconds
For 2 eggs, this should take about 1 minute, total cooking time
Carefully use a spatula to fold "parmalet" in half
